definition: to ascend/to rise to the rank of/to promote/to hoist/liter/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth dou 斗[dou3]
to move/to shift/to change (a position or location etc)/to promote

sentences.english: I think you and your family are about to burst out with joy over your big promotion.
sentences.chinese: 我想您和府上諸位，都會爲您的大升遷而極度歡樂。

sentences.english: But he is young and his route to the top is through the CSU.
sentences.chinese: 但是他還年輕，他還要在基社盟黨內步步升遷。

sentences.english: While IQ gets you hired, EQ gets you promoted.
sentences.chinese: 你因智商受聘，因情商升遷。

sentences.english: A: I feel I have reached the "glass ceiling" in my current job. I feel there is no opportunity for advancement.
sentences.chinese: 我覺得目前的工作，已經達到頂峯，即有升遷機會。

sentences.english: I can't get over the fact that Alice was promoted, and I wasn't.
sentences.chinese: 愛莉絲獲得升遷而我沒有，這件事我就是無法釋懷。

sentences.english: The new system leaves less opportunity for personal advancement.
sentences.chinese: 新制度給與個人較少的升遷機會。

sentences.english: They kicked upstairs their manager by putting him on the managing committee.
sentences.chinese: 他們通過把經理升遷至管理委員會而使他明升暗降。

sentences.english: Often, your boss is the person who will decide if youll be promoted.
sentences.chinese: 通常來說，你的老闆是決定你是否升遷的人。

sentences.english: But the project stopped again because Zhangqiu Jianqiong was promoted and left the area.
sentences.chinese: 但由於章仇兼瓊升遷而離職，工程再度停頓。

sentences.english: They have also been publicity ornaments used by local officials to boost their standing.
sentences.chinese: 一些地方官員還利用這些宣傳彩頭來謀求職位升遷。

sentences.english: We have therefore decided to begin with preferment to ecclesiastical dignities .
sentences.chinese: 因此，我們決定開始與升遷到教會尊嚴。

sentences.english: The Upsizing Wizard creates the transaction log using the size you specify.
sentences.chinese: “升遷嚮導”使用您指定的大小創建事務日誌。

sentences.english: I've worked here as a typist for about a year，and I'd like to have a chance of advancement.
sentences.chinese: 我在此已做打字員一年了，我期望一個升遷的機會。

sentences.english: Send to the director for a promotion, you I am afraid one million there is not much left.
sentences.chinese: 送點給局長謀個升遷吧，事成恐怕一百萬所剩無幾。

sentences.english: When Mrs. Wang got a promotion at work, she decided to have a celebration.
sentences.chinese: 當王太太獲得工作的升遷時，她決定舉辦一個慶祝會。

definition: an official position/a job in the bureaucracy
not knowing which course to follow (idiom); at a loss what to do
troops under one's command/subordinate/affiliated to a ministry
(Tw) to draw on (others' experience)/to learn from (how others do things)/lesson to be learned (by observing others)
